fxInfo_citation: Pemstein et al. (2018, V-Dem Working Paper Series 2018:21); V-Dem Codebook (see suggested citation at the top of this document).
fxInfo_clarification: Other types of clearly distinguishable civil violence, even if politically motivated, during the election period should not be factored in when scoring this indicator (it is dealt with separately).
fxInfo_cross_coder_aggregation: Bayesian Item Response Theory Measurement Model
fxInfo_question: In this national election, were opposition candidates/parties/campaign workers subjected to repression, intimidation, violence, or harassment by the government, the ruling party, or their agents?

fxInfo_responses.value: Yes. The repression and intimidation by the government or its agents was so strong that the entire period was quiet.
Yes, frequent: There was systematic, frequent and violent harassment and intimidation of the opposition by the government or its agents during the election period.
Yes, some. There was periodic, not systematic, but possibly centrally coordinated â€” harassment and intimidation of the opposition by the government or its agents.

Restrained. There were sporadic instances of violent harassment and intimidation by the government or its agents, in at least one part of the country, and directed at only one or two local branches of opposition groups.
None. There was no harassment or intimidation of opposition by the government or its agents, during the election campaign period and polling day.

fxInfo_scale: Ordinal, converted to interval by the measurement model
